arts.ttl: Ben Doak's Middlesbrough absence explained as Carrick expresses disappointment in cup exit
arts.sum: “We’re disappointed to lose the game, and definitely in the way that we did," Carrick said. Boro crashed out of the cup at the first time of asking for the third consecutive season under Carrick as the Boro boss made seven changes in total.

arts.ttl: Two Middlesbrough players take their chance but concerns remain with another after Blackburn loss
arts.sum: While this was of course a Boro side with seven changes, including the full four in attack, it was ultimately a familiar story for Boro in their struggles to break down low-block defences like Blackburn’s. Blackburn lacked much attacking intent as they looked to stifle Boro, and in the end had the best chance in both halves.

arts.ttl: Blackburn edge past Middlesbrough to reach fourth round
arts.sum: Andi Weimann's second-half strike was enough to see Blackburn Rovers edge past fellow Championship promotion hopefuls Middlesbrough in the FA Cup third round.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers player ratings: Weimann match-winner as defence stand firm
arts.sum: Marks out of ten as Blackburn Rovers beat Middlesbrough in The FA Cup third round

arts.ttl: John Eustace hints at Blackburn Rovers exit and delivers FA Cup verdict
arts.sum: The Blackburn Rovers head coach delivered his verdict on the victory

arts.ttl: Ben Doak's Middlesbrough absense explained as Carrick expresses disappointment in cup exit
arts.sum: “We’re disappointed to lose the game, and definitely in the way that we did," Carrick said. Boro crashed out of the cup at the first time of asking for the third consective season under Carrick as the Boro boss made seven changes in total.

arts.ttl: Andreas Weimann goal earns Blackburn FA Cup win over Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Weimann struck a minute after missing an open goal.

arts.ttl: Andi Weimann secures Blackburn Rovers passage with FA Cup win at Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers won 1-0 at The Riverside Stadium to secure their place in round four

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough loan stance clear as Michael Carrick reveals his Micah Hamilton excitement
arts.sum: Michael Carrick says he remains really excited about Micah Hamilton's future at Middlesbrough as he ruled out a loan exit for the young forward this month. He’s had a big experience over the past few months, leaving the club he’d been with from six years old, leaving home to come up here to a whole new environment.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers predicted team with rotation and seven changes at Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers will make changes at The Riverside for The FA Cup third round
